citation.article-title: Phylogeny of Maricaulis Abraham et al. 1999 and proposal of Maricaulis virginensis sp. nov., M. parjimensis sp. nov., M. washingtonensis sp. nov. and M. salignorans sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Maricaulis virginensis sp. nov.
Maricaulis virginensis (vir.gin.en'sis. N.L. adj. virginensis from the Virgin Islands)
The description is the same as that given for the genus (Abraham et al., 1999), with the following additional characteristics.
All strains are characterized by two major fatty acids, 17:0 and 18:1ω7; minor fatty acids are 14:0, 16: 0, 17:0 iso and 18:0.
The main polar lipids are α-sulfoquinovosyl diacylglycerols.
Cannot grow on PYE medium without NaCl, and optimal growth occurs between 5 and 100 gNaCl l-1.
Grows at temperatures between 10 and 40 °C, with optimal growth at 20-40 °C.
A DNA-DNA binding value of 83% was found between M. virginensis strains VKM B-1513T and VKM B-1514.
A DNA-DNA binding value of 70% was found between M. virginensis VKM B-1513T and strain MCS 26 (=LMG 19862).
This is just at the margin to include this strain in this taxon; however, strain MCS 26 displays a number of differences from M. virginensis; therefore, it is not included here in this species.
The type strain was obtained from deep sea water near a hydrothermal vent off the Virgin Islands.
The G+­C content of the type strain is 65.2 mol%.
The type strain is strain VKM B-1513T (=LMG 21018T=VC-5T=CIP 107438T).
Strain VC-13 (=VKM B-1514) is a closely related strain.
